isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL 9, 10, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - INSTALL - MAINSHAFT

warning.para: Wear safe eye protection and make sure the tools are in safe condition. If the tools are worn or damaged (mushroomed), pieces can break and cause serious personal injury.

note.para: To install the mainshaft, the input shaft and the main countershafts must be installed in the case.
Apply Loctite #242 or equivalent on the threads of the fasteners.

step1.para: Lubricate all parts with new oil that is used in the transmission. Refer to GROUP 10-LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

note.para: The rear bearing cone must be installed on the upper countershaft.

step1.para: Move the upper countershaft toward the side of the case (Figure 314).
Install a long bolt or T-Handle Tool in the hole in the front of the upper countershaft. The tool or the bolt makes the countershaft easier to move.

figure.caption: Figure 314. Install T-Handle Tool

step1.para: Rotate the input shaft and move the lower countershaft assembly so that the timing marks are aligned (Figure 315).

figure.caption: Figure 315. Align Timing Marks

step1.para: Remove the snap ring to remove the auxiliary drive gear assembly from the mainshaft.
Remove the snap ring that fastens the reverse gear to the mainshaft. Slide the reverse gear forward until the gear touches the low gear (Figure 316).
Install the sliding collar on the front of the mainshaft (Figure 316).

figure.caption: Figure 316. Slide Reverse Gear Forward and Install Sliding Collar

step1.para: Put the lifting hooks or a rope under the mainshaft assembly. Install the mainshaft assembly in the case. Make sure the front of the mainshaft is installed in the bushing in the input shaft. Temporarily install the auxiliary drive gear to support the rear of the mainshaft. Remove the lifting hooks or rope (Figure 317).

figure.caption: Figure 317. Put Lifting Hooks or a Rope Under Mainshaft Assembly

caution.para: The mainshaft must be supported when the countershaft is serviced. If not supported, the timing marks fall out of alignment. The weight of the mainshaft will also damage the thrust washers between the gears.

step1.para: Install the auxiliary drive gear and arrange the assembly so that the mainshaft is supported in the case.
Align the timing marks on the main drive gear of the input shaft with the timing marks on the upper countershaft. Use the T-Handle Tool or the long bolt to move the countershafts (Figure 318).
Remove the T-Handle Tool or long bolts from the countershafts.

note.para: The bearing cone must be installed on the rear of the countershaft.

figure.caption: Figure 318. Align Timing Marks

step1.para: Design Level 1 Transmissions: install the upper rear bearing cup and the upper front bearing cup and cone on the countershaft.

step2.para: Put the cup in the bore for the upper rear countershaft. Use a plastic hammer to install the cup in the bore.
Use a hammer and bearing driver tool to install the upper rear countershaft cup. The cup is correctly installed when the cup is past the snap ring groove (Figure 319).

figure.caption: Figure 319. Install Upper Rear Countershaft Cup

caution.para: Use hand tools to rotate the forcing screw of the countershaft bearing pusher tool. If power tools are used, the tool will be damaged.

step2.para: Install Countershaft Bearing Pusher Tool or equivalent on the front of the countershaft. Rotate the forcing screw until the rear countershaft bearing cup is against the snap ring ( Figure 320).

figure.caption: Figure 320. Install Countershaft Bearing Pusher Tool

step2.para: Use a hammer and bearing driver tool to install the upper front countershaft cone. The cone is correctly installed when the cone touches the countershaft (Figure 321).

figure.caption: Figure 321. Install Upper Front Countershaft Cone

warning.para: Wear safe eye protection and make sure the tools are in safe condition. If the tools are worn or damaged (mushroomed), pieces can break and cause serious personal injury.

step2.para: Use a hammer and bearing driver tool to install the upper front countershaft cup. The cup is correctly installed when the cup is past the snap ring groove (Figure 322).

figure.caption: Figure 322. Install Upper Front Countershaft Cup

step2.para: Install a 1.73 mm (.068 inch) snap ring in the bore for the front countershaft. The snap O-ring is used as a gauge (Figure 323).

figure.caption: Figure 323. Install Snap Ring in Bore for Front Countershaft

step2.para: Install T-Handle Tool or a long bolt in the front of the countershaft (Figure 324).
Pull the countershaft and front cone assembly into the cup until the front cup is against the snap ring (Figure 324).

figure.caption: Figure 324. Install T-Handle Tool and Pull Countershaft and Front Cone Assembly into Cup

step2.para: Remove the T-Handle Tool or the long bolt.

note.para: The bearing cone must be installed on the rear of the countershaft.

step1.para: Design Level 2 Transmissions:install the upper rear bearing cup and the upper front bearing cup and cone on the countershaft.

step2.para: Put the cup in the bore for the upper rear countershaft. Use a plastic hammer to install the cup in the bore.

warning.para: Wear safe eye protection and make sure the tools are in safe condition. If the tools are worn or damaged (mushroomed), pieces can break and cause serious personal injury.

caution.para: Install the cup so that the cup extends at least 3 mm (0.125 or 1/8 inch) above the surface of the case. Make sure the Driver Tool does not touch any part of the bearing cone or the cone will be damaged.

step2.para: Use a hammer and bearing driver to install the rear cup in the bore. The cup is correctly installed when the cup extends 3 mm (0.125 or 1/8 inch) above the surface of the case (Figure 325).

figure.caption: Figure 325. Install Rear Cup in Bore

step2.para: Clean three bolts that fasten the countershaft rear bearing retainer to the main case Apply Loctite #242 or equivalent to the threads of the bolts.

caution.para: Use a new hardened countershaft bearing retainer to install the rear countershaft cup. If a retainer that is not hardened is used, the transmission will be damaged.

step2.para: Put a hardened countershaft rear bearing retainer in position of the main case. Install the bolts. Alternately and evenly tighten the bolts 47 Nm (35 ft-lbs.) until the retainer touches the main case (Figure 326).

figure.caption: Figure 326. Alternately and Evenly Tighten Bolts

warning.para: Wear safe eye protection and make sure the tools are in safe condition. If the tools are worn or damaged (mushroomed), pieces can break and cause serious personal injury.

step2.para: Use a hammer and bearing driver tool to install the upper front countershaft cone. The cone is correctly installed when the bottom of the cone is against the countershaft (Figure 327).

figure.caption: Figure 327. Install Upper Front Countershaft Cone

step2.para: Put the cup in the bore for the upper front countershaft. Use a plastic hammer to start installing the cup in the bore.

warning.para: Wear safe eye protection and make sure the tools are in safe condition. If the tools are worn or damaged (mushroomed), pieces can break and cause serious personal injury.

step2.para: Use a hammer and bearing driver tool to install the upper front countershaft cup. The cup is correctly installed when the cup touches the bearing cone ( Figure 328).

figure.caption: Figure 328. Install Upper Front Countershaft Cup

step2.para: Use a hammer and bearing driver to install the front cup in the bore. The cup is correctly installed when the cup extends 3 mm (0.125 inch) above the surface of the case.

Install the shims in the bore for the upper front countershaft bearing. Replace any worn or damaged shims. Make sure the slot for the oil passage on the shims is aligned with the oil passage hole. Install a 0.127 mm (0.005 inch) shim or a 0.190 mm (0.0075 inch) shim ( Figure 329).

figure.caption: Figure 329. Align Slot With Oil Passage Hole

note.para: Make sure the retainer and the shims are correctly installed against the case. Make sure the retainer does not push the shims against the cup or the end play will not be correct.

step2.para: Install a new retainer for the upper and lower front countershaft bearings. Install the Allen-head bolts. Alternately and evenly tighten the bolts to 14 Nm (120 in-lbs.) (Figure 330).

figure.caption: Figure 330. Install New Retainer and Allen-Head Bolts

step1.para: Check the end play on the upper and lower main countershafts as described in ADJUSTMENT, MAIN COUNTERSHAFT END PLAY section. The end play is between 0.051 to 0.152 mm (0.002 to 0.006 inch).
Install the needle bearing assembly inside the upper reverse idler gear (Figure 331).
Install the inner race inside the needle bearing assembly ( Figure 331).
Install a spacer washer on each side of the reverse idler gear ( Figure 331).

figure.caption: Figure 331. Install Needle Bearing Assembly, Inner Race, and Spacer Washers

step1.para: Put the reverse idler gear in position in the top of the case.
Install the shaft through the reverse idler gear assembly from the auxiliary cover side of the transmission case.
Install the nut and washer on the upper reverse idler gear assembly. Hold the end of the shaft with a screwdriver. Tighten the nut to 102 to 136 Nm (75 to 100 ft-lbs.) (Figure 332).

figure.caption: Figure 332. Install Nut and Washer on Upper Reverse Idler Gear Assembly

step1.para: Move the reverse gear to the rear of the mainshaft. Remove the auxiliary drive gear (Figure 333).

figure.caption: Figure 333. Move Reverse Gear to Rear of Mainshaft

step1.para: Install a new snap ring that fastens the reverse gear on the mainshaft. Make sure the snap ring is completely installed in the groove (Figure 334).

figure.caption: Figure 334. Install Snap Ring Fastening Reverse Gear on Mainshaft

step1.para: Install the thrust washer on the mainshaft ( Figure 335).

figure.caption: Figure 335. Install Thrust Washer on Mainshaft

step1.para: Install the auxiliary drive gear assembly on the mainshaft and in the rear of the case.

figure.caption: Figure 336. Round Retainer

step3.para: Install the retainer, bearing and gear assembly on the mainshaft. Make sure the groove for the snap ring on the shaft is visible.
Rotate the retainer so that the holes in the retainer are aligned with the bores in the case.
Install and tighten the bolts to 47 to 61 Nm (35 to 45 ft-lbs.).

figure.caption: Figure 337. Two-Piece Retainer

step3.para: Install the bearing assembly in the case over the mainshaft.
Install the two-piece retainer on the case.
Install and tighten the bolts to 47 to 61 Nm (35 to 45 ft-lbs.).
Install the auxiliary drive gear on the mainshaft. Make sure the groove for the snap ring on the shaft is visible.

step1.para: Install a new snap ring that fastens the auxiliary drive gear on the main shaft (Figure 336).
